intro: Uncinia polyneura, commonly known as the roughleaf sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically rough and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Uncinia polyneura is often found in rocky soils and sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
